messages.message:
The reason is that apply-udf and the new flow-tasks will schedule in the same celery-worker-pool.

So let’s say you have *n* celery workers all running apply-udf at the same time.  They call out to the Flow API to schedule the Flow and then wait for the Flow to complete.  Now, the newly schedule flow won’t have any any more tasks where they can execute.

The only case where this would be OK is when you are actually not waiting on the Flow to complete, but then state management becomes really complicated.
This is the same reason why celery doesn’t allow a task to be scheduled synchronously by another task.
